main_definition: Most refers to the greatest in number, amount, or degree.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to indicate that something is greater than others in quantity or extent. For example: 'She has read most of the books on my list.'
meanings_and_examples.example: John ate most of the cookies at the party.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Indicates an extreme degree or highest level. For example: 'This is the most challenging project I've ever worked on.'
meanings_and_examples.example: It was the most beautiful sunset he had ever seen.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to express a high probability, often in conjunction with words like likely or probably. For example: 'I think it will rain today; it's going to be the most rainy day of the month.'
meanings_and_examples.example: He is the most talented musician I know.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refers to a majority, more than half. For example: 'Most people prefer coffee over tea in the morning.'
meanings_and_examples.example: Most students passed the exam with flying colors.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to emphasize or draw attention to something as being very important. For example: 'This is most likely what caused the issue.'
meanings_and_examples.example: It was a most unexpected turn of events.
